results.title: Autism : The Early Signs
results.brief_description: This video comes with an education kit produced by the Autistic Family Support Association. Together they promote the early detection and diagnosis of autism in young children. The video is a visual representation of the behavioural characteristics of autism, and, through three case studies, shows the difficulties arising from living with a child who appears normal but whose behaviour is disturbing. Most importantly, it stresses the role of parents, people working with young children and health professionals in picking up the first clues that a child may be autistic.

results.title: Australians at the Olympics
results.creator_credit: Edwin Morrisby, National Panasonic and Southern Latitude Films
results.brief_description: Based on the book by sports journalist Gary Lester, the program is hosted by Olympic Gold medal winner John Konrads. Covers Australian competitors in Olympics from Athens in 1896 to Moscow in 1980. Rare footage is seen and some interviews with Australian champions such as Betty Cuthbert, Hubert Opperman, Dawn Fraser and others.

results.title: Australian is a wide word
results.brief_description: Perhaps the most pertinent issue of this video is why some or many of us have difficulties defining the term “Australian”, particularly in describing ourselves. The title is the response of one person in the video to this issue.

results.title: Australian business number : the key to your business
results.brief_description: This video provides information about the new Australian Business Number (ABN) introduced with the Goods and Services Tax. It includes information on who should register and how to register for an ABN. Presented by Michael Caton.

results.title: Australian business achievers (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Shaun Brown, Ivor J. Davies, DECO Corporation and Training Media Services
results.brief_description: Profiles five high achieving Australian business people and their philosophies for success. Those profiled include; Rob Cartwright, Keith Williams, Jodee Rich, Guido Belgiorno and Sam Gance.

results.title: Australia big beef country
results.brief_description: This film is concerned with local beef production in Australia’s tropics with the emphasis being placed on the use of improved pastures and new breeding stock to improve quality. Hygienic conditions for the production of boneless beef is ensured through government inspection. No other credits available.

results.title: Australia's wonderful wildlife
results.creator_credit: Grant Young and GEO Wildlife Documentaries
results.brief_description: The Australian continent has been isolate for a very long time and its animal inhabitants have evolved in isolation to produce a wildlife community very different from that found anywhere else in the world. This video is a sample of Australia’s unique fauna, with 60 seconds of footage on each animal. Some of the animals will be familiar to everyone, others are not so familiar, but all are distinctively Australian. Animals discussed include: Platypus; Koala; Emu; Kookaburra; Taipan and the Shingleback.

results.title: Australia's religions communities: a multimedia exploration (PC & MAC)
results.creator_credit: Christian Research Association and Redfish Bluefish (Creative)
results.brief_description: The nature of religion in Australia is changing. Over the last 200 years, millions of immigrants have brought to Australia a great range of religious traditions. Since 1946, that diversity has increased all the more rapidly. All the major religious traditions of the world may now be found in Australia. At the same time, several other trends are evident. Australians are making choices about their spirituality in ways they have never done before. They are trying out the variety of options found in Australia, and drawing on the various resources. Many have detached themselves from specific religious organisations, but most continue to value the spiritual dimension of life and put together their own sense of spirituality and meaning. There is new awareness of the spiritual heritage of the Aboriginal people particularly in relationship to the land. This CD-ROM explores the world of faiths and meaning and includes all the major religions plus many of the lesser known, smaller alternative religions. It will help you explore your own traditions and background, the heritages of your neighbours and friends, and Australian history and the dynamics of contemporary society.

results.title: Australia's inland sea
results.brief_description: This film received the Amateur Award in the 1951 Jubilee Film Competition. Three young Australians journeyed to Lake Eyre in the early 1950’s when the lake was filled with water from the highlands of Central Queensland.
